responses.english: Hello! How are you feeling today?
responses.yoruba: Báwo ni? Báwo ni ìmọ̀lára rẹ ṣe rí lónìí?
responses.pidgin: How far? How your body dey today?

responses.english: Marriage should be a choice, not a cage. Your feelings matter. Let’s talk safety plans if you need to resist or leave.
responses.yoruba: Ìgbéyàwó kì í ṣe ìṣẹ̀—ọwọ́ rẹ ní kó ṣeé ṣe. Ẹ̀rọ rẹ ṣe pàtàkì. Jẹ́ ká sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ọ̀nà àbò.
responses.pidgin: Marriage na by force? Your heart matter. If you need run or stand your ground, make we plan am safely.

responses.english: That exhaustion is real. You’re not lazy—you’re drained from fighting a system that makes it hard to thrive. Let’s rebuild your strength step by step.
responses.yoruba: Ìgbẹ́kẹ̀ẹ́ rẹ̀ tóò. Kò ṣẹ́lẹ̀ rẹ—ìdààmú àti ìṣòro òwò ló ń pa ọ lẹ́rù. Jẹ́ ká bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní ṣíṣe àtúnṣe ní ìlànà.
responses.pidgin: Wahala for no get job no be small. You no be lazy person—na system hard. Make we start small small to bring back your hope.

responses.english: Post-NYSC depression is so common. That ‘what next?’ feeling doesn’t mean you’re failing—it means you’re in transition. We’ll navigate this together.
responses.yoruba: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ọ̀pọ̀ ló ń rí ìfẹ̀ẹ́rẹ̀ báyìí lẹ́yìn NYSC. Kò ní ṣeé ṣe rẹ—ọ ń ṣíṣàlàyé àyè tuntun. A ó ṣiṣẹ́ pọ̀.
responses.pidgin: Many pipo dey feel like dis after NYSC. That ‘wetin next?’ no mean say you fail—na just new phase. Make we figure am out together.

responses.english: Academic pressure in Nigeria can feel like drowning. You’re not just a grade or a degree—you’re a person who deserves rest too.
responses.yoruba: Ìfẹ́sẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ní ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ lè dà bí ìríbọ̀mì. Ọ̀wọ̀ rẹ kì í ṣe ìdánwò nìkan—ìwọ jẹ́ ènìyàn tó yẹ ìsinmi.
responses.pidgin: School wahala fit make person run mad. You no be your result—you be human wey need break sef.

responses.english: Substances often feel like the only escape from pain. But healing starts when we face the hurt together. You’re not alone in this fight.
responses.yoruba: Àwọn ohun ìdáàbòbò lè dà bí ònà ìyẹ̀sí kan ṣoṣo, ṣùgbọ́n ìwòsàn ń bẹ̀rẹ̀ nígbà tí a bá ń ṣojú ìfẹ̀yìntì pọ̀. Ẹni ò kan rẹ nìkan.
responses.pidgin: Wetin you dey take run from pain no be solution. But we fit find better way to heal. I go dey with you.

responses.english: Social media sells highlight reels, not real life. Your journey is valid—even the messy, unseen parts. Let’s mute the noise together.
responses.yoruba: Ìkànnì ayélujára ń ta àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ dídára, kì í ṣe ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ gidi. Ìrìnàjò rẹ ṣeé ṣe—àti àwọn apá rẹ tí a kò rí. Jẹ́ ká dẹ́kun ìró pọ̀.
responses.pidgin: Wetin you see for social media no be true life. Your own struggle dey valid—even if nobody no see am. Make we ignore bad vibes.

responses.english: Trauma isn’t your fault. Your body remembers, but healing is possible. We’ll go at your pace—you’re safe here.
responses.yoruba: Ìdààbòbò kì í ṣe ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ rẹ. Ara rẹ ń rántí, ṣùgbọ́n ìwòsàn wà. A ó lọ ní ìlànà rẹ—o dúró síbẹ̀ dáadáa.
responses.pidgin: Wetin happen to you before no be your fault. Your body still dey remind you, but we go heal small small. You safe here.

responses.english: Family pressure in Nigeria is a unique kind of heavy. You’re allowed to want boundaries—and peace.
responses.yoruba: Ìfúnilórí ìdílé ní Nàìjíríà lè wúwo gan-an. Ó ṣeé ṣe fún ọ láti fẹ́ ààlà àti àlàáfíà.
responses.pidgin: Na only who be firstborn for Naija house go sabi dis pressure. You fit set boundaries—you deserve peace.

responses.english: Stigma makes healing harder, but your pain is real. Therapy isn’t ‘for mad people’—it’s for anyone who hurts.
responses.yoruba: Àríyànjiyàn ń ṣòro ìwòsàn, ṣùgbọ́n irora rẹ jẹ́ ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀. Ìtọ́jú ọkàn ò jẹ́ ‘fún àwọn wèrè’—ò jẹ́ fún ẹnikẹ́ni tó ń yo.
responses.pidgin: Na stigma dey make am hard to talk. But your pain real well well. Therapy no be only for mad pipo—na for anybody wey dey suffer.

responses.english: Thank you for trusting me with this. You’re not alone—we’ll figure this out together.
responses.yoruba: O ṣeun fún ìgbàgbọ́ rẹ. Ẹni ò kan rẹ nìkan—a ó ṣe àlàyé pọ̀.
responses.pidgin: Thanks for opening up. You no dey alone—we go solve am together.

responses.english: The pressure to ‘japa’ can feel overwhelming when Nigeria’s systems keep failing you. Your worth isn’t tied to a country—your resilience matters wherever you are.
responses.yoruba: Ìfẹ́sẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ láti ‘japa’ lè dún bí ìṣòro ṣùgbọ́n ọwọ́ rẹ kì í ṣe ilẹ̀ kan. Ìdíyẹ̀ rẹ ṣe pàtàkì níbikíbi tí o bá wà.
responses.pidgin: This Japa matter fit make person pressurize. But remember say your value no be for visa—na you dey carry am go anywhere.

responses.english: It’s exhausting to care when leaders keep failing us. But your anger is valid—it means you still believe Nigeria *could* be better. Let’s channel that fire.
responses.yoruba: Ó rọrùn láti nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí orílẹ̀-èdè tí àwọn aláṣẹ ń ṣàìṣododo. Ṣùgbọ́n ibínú rẹ tọ́—ó túmọ̀ sí pé o ṣì ní ìretí fún Nàìjíríà. Jẹ́ ká fi okùn inú rẹ ṣe nǹkan.
responses.pidgin: Na normal to tire when leaders dey fail us. But your anger show say you still get hope. Make we use that fire do something small.

responses.english: Nigerian beauty standards can be cruel. But your body is not a problem—it’s a home. Let’s unlearn those lies together.
responses.yoruba: Àwọn ìdánilójú ẹwà ní Nàìjíríà lè ṣe tẹ̀mí. Ṣùgbọ́n ara rẹ kì í ṣe ìṣòro—ilé rẹ ni. Jẹ́ ká bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í gbàgbé àwọn ìrọ́ yìí.
responses.pidgin: Naija beauty standard no be joke. But your body no be crime—na your house. Make we fight this shame together.

responses.english: Loneliness in a crowded country like Nigeria is its own kind of pain. You deserve connection—let’s find ways to build it gently.
responses.yoruba: Ìfẹ̀ẹ́rẹ̀ àlàáfíà ní orílẹ̀-èdè tí ó kún fún ènìyàn lè ṣe tẹ̀mí. O yẹ kí o ní ìbátan—jẹ́ ká ṣe é ní ìlànà tí ó lọ̀ọ̀rẹ̀.
responses.pidgin: Feel lonely for where plenty pipo dey like Naija na hard thing. But you deserve people wey go understand—make we find am step by step.

responses.english: Questioning your faith doesn’t make you a ‘bad believer.’ Even in doubt, you’re allowed to seek your own truth.
responses.yoruba: Ìbéèrè lórí ìgbàgbọ́ rẹ kì í ṣe ọ̀dàlẹ̀. Nínú ìyèméjì, ó ṣeé ṣe fún ọ láti wá òtítọ́ rẹ.
responses.pidgin: If you dey ask why God no answer, no mean say you no holy. Your questions valid—truth no dey run.

responses.english: Creative blocks often mean your soul is processing something. Rest isn’t laziness—it’s part of the work. Your voice will return.
responses.yoruba: Ìdínkù ìṣẹ́ ọkàn máa ń túmọ̀ sí pé ẹ̀mí rẹ ń ṣe nǹkan. Ìsinmi kì í ṣe ògẹ́—ó jẹ́ apá iṣẹ́. Ohùn rẹ yóò padà.
responses.pidgin: When creativity no come, no mean say you finish. Even machine need cool down. Your gift go come back stronger.

responses.english: Nigeria’s gender boxes can feel like prisons. You’re allowed to exist outside them—your identity is yours to define.
responses.yoruba: Àwọn ìdíbi ọkùnrin àti obìnrin ní Nàìjíríà lè dà bí àwọn ọ̀wọ̀. Ó ṣeé ṣe fún ọ láti wà ní ìhà yòókù—ìdí rẹ tì ẹ ni.
responses.pidgin: This ‘man must be hard’ or ‘woman must soft’ no be law. You fit just be yourself—na your life.

responses.english: Caring for aging parents in Nigeria’s harsh economy is a heavy load. You’re doing your best—that’s enough.
responses.yoruba: Ìtọ́jú àwọn òbí tí ń dàgbà ní ọrọ̀ ajé Nàìjíríà lè wúwo. O ń ṣe ohun tí o lè ṣe—ìyẹn tó.
responses.pidgin: To dey care for old mama and papa for this economy no be small thing. Your best na enough—no guilt.

responses.english: The ‘tech hustle’ pressure is real, but your journey is unique. You don’t have to rush—consistent small steps matter more.
responses.yoruba: Ìfẹ́sẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ‘tech’ lè ṣòro, ṣùgbọ́n ọ̀nà rẹ yàtọ̀. Kò ní ṣeé ṣe fún ọ láti yára—àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ kékeré ṣe pàtàkì.
responses.pidgin: This pressure to become tech bro no be small. But your own pace dey valid—small progress still na progress.

responses.english: Nigeria’s climate struggles—floods, heat, no light—add another layer to daily stress. Your frustration is valid. Let’s talk coping strategies.
responses.yoruba: Ìṣòro ojú-ọjọ́ ní Nàìjíríà—ìṣán omi, òyún, àìsí iná—ń ṣàfikún ìfẹ̀sẹ̀wọnsẹ̀. Ìbínú rẹ tọ́. Jẹ́ ká sọ̀rọ̀ nípa àwọn ọ̀nà ìfarabalẹ̀.
responses.pidgin: Flood, heat, no light—e don be like say Naija environment dey fight us. Your pain valid. Make we find how you fit manage am.
